content.description:
Directions:

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is a real number. Angle measures for trigonometric functions are assumed to be in radians.

Solutions to equations must be real numbers. Determine the exact value of any expression that can be obtained without a calculator. For example, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>8</mn></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>, and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msup> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mfenced> <mn>1</mn> </mfenced> </math> can be evaluated without a calculator.

Unless otherwise specified, combine terms using algebraic methods and rules for exponents and logarithms, where applicable. For example, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>, and <math alttext="ln 3 plus ln 5" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>ln</mi><mpadded lspace="-1px"><mn>3</mn></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>ln</mi><mpadded lspace="-1px"><mn>5</mn></mpadded></math> should be rewritten in equivalent forms.

For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.
content.question:
Part B

​​​The functions <math alttext="j"><mi>j</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> are given by

<math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 10 open parentheses 8 x to the power of 5 close parentheses plus log subscript 10 open parentheses 2 x squared close parentheses minus 9 log subscript 10 x"> <mi>j</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>-</mo> <mn>9</mn> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mi>x</mi> </math>

<math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses fraction numerator 1 minus sin squared x over denominator sin x end fraction close parentheses sec x"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mfenced><mi>sec</mi><mi>x</mi></math>.

(i) Rewrite <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single logarithm base <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math> without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math alttext="log subscript 10 open parentheses text expression end text close parentheses"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mtext>expression</mtext></mfenced></math>.

(ii) Rewrite <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single term involving <math alttext="tan x"><mi>tan</mi><mi>x</mi></math>.

frqParts.text:
Part B

​​​The functions <math alttext="j"><mi>j</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> are given by

<math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 10 open parentheses 8 x to the power of 5 close parentheses plus log subscript 10 open parentheses 2 x squared close parentheses minus 9 log subscript 10 x"> <mi>j</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>-</mo> <mn>9</mn> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mi>x</mi> </math>

<math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses fraction numerator 1 minus sin squared x over denominator sin x end fraction close parentheses sec x"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mfenced><mi>sec</mi><mi>x</mi></math>.

(i) Rewrite <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single logarithm base <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math> without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math alttext="log subscript 10 open parentheses text expression end text close parentheses"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mtext>expression</mtext></mfenced></math>.

(ii) Rewrite <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single term involving <math alttext="tan x"><mi>tan</mi><mi>x</mi></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
